00:25:17,064 --> 00:25:21,109
She's busy. Go play with your dolls
or something, okay?

249
00:25:21,151 --> 00:25:23,487
I don't have any dolls.

250
00:25:23,570 --> 00:25:26,949
Get some food, huh?

251
00:25:26,991 --> 00:25:29,993
Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police.

252
00:25:35,706 --> 00:25:39,377
- "Somebody already bought me dinner.
The police."
- ( Laughing )

253
00:25:49,386 --> 00:25:52,639
Thirty, forty dollars.

254
00:25:54,391 --> 00:25:56,852
Who the fuck is this now?

255
00:25:56,893 --> 00:26:01,063
Hey! Piss off!
We're closed!

256
00:26:01,147 --> 00:26:03,816
- Cerrado!
- ( Pounding )

257
00:26:03,900 --> 00:26:07,736
Sleep it off somewhere else, dusthead,
unless you want to get mutilated.

258
00:26:13,242 --> 00:26:15,243

259
00:26:15,327 --> 00:26:19,581
Goddamn creatures of the night,

260
00:26:21,291 --> 00:26:23,042
Hey! Hey!

261
00:26:25,086 --> 00:26:27,172

- ( Screams )

262
00:26:27,255 --> 00:26:31,634
"Suddenly I heard

263

rapping at my chamber door."

264

265
00:26:39,975 --> 00:26:42,686
You heard me rapping, right?

266
00:26:42,770 --> 00:26:46,898
You're trespassing,
and you owe me a fucking new door!

267
00:26:49,317 --> 00:26:52,279

268
00:26:52,362 --> 00:26:53,738
Gold.

269
00:26:53,821 --> 00:26:56,157
You're looking for a coroner,

270
00:27:00,411 --> 00:27:05,541
Oh, shit.
Oh, shit on me!

271
00:27:05,624 --> 00:27:08,169
Shit on me.
Shit on me!

272
00:27:14,299 --> 00:27:16,551
- Aaah!
- Mr. Gideon.

273
00:27:16,635 --> 00:27:18,886
You're not paying attention.

274
00:27:21,806 --> 00:27:23,975
No! ( Screaming )

275
00:27:24,058 --> 00:27:29,355

engagement ring, yes?

276
00:27:30,981 --> 00:27:34,442
It was pawned here a year ago

277
00:27:37,154 --> 00:27:40,823
He confided in me

278
00:27:40,907 --> 00:27:44,077

279

280

281

282
00:27:54,378 --> 00:27:57,172
Don't any of your street demons

283

This could be a turf hit, but it doesn't

284
00:28:01,510 --> 00:28:06,222
Come on, Albrecht, spare me.
You're a beat cop now, so be a beat cop.

285
00:28:06,306 --> 00:28:08,224
I'm suppose to thank you
for that, right?

286
00:28:08,308 --> 00:28:12,061
Word to the wise:
Watch your fucking mouth.

287
00:28:13,270 --> 00:28:15,690
What the hell
do you call that?

288
00:28:16,732 --> 00:28:19,318
I call it blood, detective.

289
00:28:19,401 --> 00:28:23,197
I suppose you'll write it up

290
00:28:23,238 --> 00:28:26,033
You can leave
my crime scene now, okay?

291
00:28:26,075 --> 00:28:30,078

292
00:28:32,748 --> 00:28:35,666

- What are you doing?

293

- What game?

294
00:28:38,419 --> 00:28:41,339

I'll tell you about the rings!

295
00:28:41,422 --> 00:28:45,801
They're in that metal box!

296
00:28:45,884 --> 00:28:51,389
Take the fucking rings!
Choke on them, you son of a bitch!

297
00:28:54,976 --> 00:28:57,563
- Look, it goes to the attic.

298
00:29:06,737 --> 00:29:08,739
No, no.

299
00:29:08,823 --> 00:29:11,951
No, no, no.

300
00:29:14,453 --> 00:29:18,665
Oh, it's beautiful.
I don't believe it.

301
00:29:22,585 --> 00:29:24,963
Shelly.

302
00:29:33,137 --> 00:29:34,514
I love you.

303
00:29:39,601 --> 00:29:42,479
( Groaning )

304
00:29:42,563 --> 00:29:45,482
- You have one chance to live.
- Take anything you want.

305
00:29:45,565 --> 00:29:48,652

- Take anything!

306
00:29:48,735 --> 00:29:51,571
Now you're going to tell me
where to find...

307

little party pals.

308
00:29:54,365 --> 00:29:56,743
The Pit. They all
hang out at The Pit.

309
00:29:56,826 --> 00:30:01,914
T-birds's little potato-heads hang out

310
00:30:01,997 --> 00:30:05,000

- Oh, baby, oh.

311
00:30:05,084 --> 00:30:08,837

- Please!

312
00:30:08,920 --> 00:30:11,673

313
00:30:11,756 --> 00:30:14,426

314

Each one of these is a life...

315
00:30:19,555 --> 00:30:22,058

316
00:30:22,142 --> 00:30:24,768
I'm begging you.
Don't kill me.

317
00:30:24,810 --> 00:30:28,522
I'm not gonna kill you.

318
00:30:28,606 --> 00:30:32,776
Your job will be to tell the rest

319

320
00:30:41,409 --> 00:30:45,622
Tell them Eric Draven

321
00:30:47,498 --> 00:30:51,586
You walk outta here,
they're gonna erase your sorry ass.

322
00:30:51,669 --> 00:30:55,297
You're nothing but street grease,

323
00:30:55,380 --> 00:30:57,507
Is that gasoline I smell?

324
00:30:57,591 --> 00:31:00,552
No, man, no!
No!

325
00:31:00,594 --> 00:31:02,680
No!

326
00:31:02,721 --> 00:31:04,055
No!

327
00:31:07,100 --> 00:31:09,728
( Screaming )

328
00:31:13,064 --> 00:31:17,902
( Screaming )

329
00:31:19,736 --> 00:31:23,198
It's on the house, kiddo,

330
00:31:23,282 --> 00:31:25,576
One root beer.

331

332
00:31:30,413 --> 00:31:34,876
Your mom... technically,

333
00:31:34,959 --> 00:31:37,086
Yeah, way off.

334
00:31:38,254 --> 00:31:41,591

335

Police! Don't move!
I said, "Don't move!"

336
00:31:46,637 --> 00:31:49,681
I thought the police

337
00:31:49,764 --> 00:31:53,685
I am the police and I say don't move,

338
00:31:53,769 --> 00:31:58,940
And I say I'm dead and I move.

339
00:31:58,982 --> 00:32:02,318
Not one more step.

340
00:32:02,360 --> 00:32:06,739
Then shoot, if you will,
Officer Albrecht.

341
00:32:06,822 --> 00:32:09,951

342
00:32:10,034 --> 00:32:11,744
You high?

343

344
00:32:15,080 --> 00:32:19,084
How about Shelly?
Do you remember Shelly Webster?

345
00:32:19,168 --> 00:32:21,836
Shelly Webster's dead, my friend.

346
00:32:21,878 --> 00:32:26,508
I want you to move over to the curb,

347
00:32:26,550 --> 00:32:31,387
Okay, we're gonna
wait here for backup.

348
00:32:31,470 --> 00:32:35,934
- It's getting too weird for me.
- Oh, it gets better.

349
00:32:36,017 --> 00:32:38,435
Do you know someone named T-bird?

350
00:32:38,519 --> 00:32:43,107

351
00:32:43,190 --> 00:32:45,775
You're the guy

352
00:32:45,859 --> 00:32:49,362
- ( Looter ) Check it out.
- He was already dead.

353
00:32:49,446 --> 00:32:54,784
- ( Glass Shattering )

354
00:32:54,867 --> 00:32:58,538

They just don't know it yet.

355
00:32:58,621 --> 00:33:01,040
Get away from there!

356
00:33:01,123 --> 00:33:04,251
Cops!
Get outta here!

357
00:33:04,293 --> 00:33:07,712

- ( Looter ) Leave it, run!

358
00:33:13,093 --> 00:33:17,430
- Oh, great, great.
- ( Siren Wailing )

359

Guy shows up looking like

360

361

Well, at least he didn't do that walking

362
00:33:28,482 --> 00:33:32,402

363
00:33:33,987 --> 00:33:36,698

364

365
00:33:40,076 --> 00:33:44,331

366
00:33:47,917 --> 00:33:50,503

367
00:33:50,586 --> 00:33:54,214

368

369
00:33:58,927 --> 00:34:01,388
Seeing is believing,

370
00:34:08,311 --> 00:34:12,106

371
00:34:12,190 --> 00:34:15,193
Mmm, yummy.

372
00:34:20,531 --> 00:34:24,493
Gideon's pawnshop just burned down

373
00:34:24,577 --> 00:34:27,787

374
00:34:27,871 --> 00:34:29,623

375
00:34:29,706 --> 00:34:32,376

376

One of my crew got himself perished.

377
00:34:35,837 --> 00:34:38,131

- Tin Tin.

378

379
00:34:42,843 --> 00:34:45,429
Gentlemen, by all means,
I think we ought to have...

380
00:34:45,513 --> 00:34:48,682

381
00:34:51,351 --> 00:34:53,937
You're working for me

382
00:34:54,021 --> 00:34:56,814
- Whatever you say, I can do.
- Good.

383
00:34:56,856 --> 00:34:59,692
That's very reassuring.

384
00:34:59,734 --> 00:35:03,780
I still ain't heard

385
00:35:03,864 --> 00:35:08,326

386

387
00:35:37,186 --> 00:35:39,063

388
00:35:41,273 --> 00:35:43,775

389

Let go, you creep!

390
00:35:49,781 --> 00:35:51,532
- Nah.
- ( Laughing )

391
00:35:51,616 --> 00:35:54,911
You didn't even slow down,

392
00:35:56,329 --> 00:35:58,706
He couldn't have stopped.

393
00:35:58,789 --> 00:36:03,085
He was a buttface.
I could have made it.

394
00:36:03,169 --> 00:36:06,214
What are you supposed to be,

395
00:36:06,297 --> 00:36:08,298
Sometimes.

396

It's more like surfing than skating.
I wish the rain would stop, just once.

397
00:36:16,264 --> 00:36:19,768

- Eric?

398
00:36:29,110 --> 00:36:32,237

399

400
00:36:41,371 --> 00:36:45,708

401
00:36:45,791 --> 00:36:49,212

402

403
00:36:53,590 --> 00:36:55,634

404
00:36:55,718 --> 00:36:58,596
Big "kick me" sign for a very nice girl
who found herself a cause.

405
00:36:58,679 --> 00:37:02,766

406
00:37:02,849 --> 00:37:08,730
Shelly Webster and her nice
rock-and-roll boyfriend, Eric Draven.

407
00:37:08,813 --> 00:37:12,358

408
00:37:12,442 --> 00:37:16,446

409
00:37:23,452 --> 00:37:27,205

410
00:37:27,247 --> 00:37:29,374
I'm cool.

411
00:37:29,458 --> 00:37:34,212

And don't tell me you owe me one.

412
00:37:34,253 --> 00:37:36,756
Ah, I owe you one!

413
00:37:36,840 --> 00:37:38,883
Yeah, right.

414
00:37:38,925 --> 00:37:41,093
Damn.

415
00:37:54,690 --> 00:37:58,151

416
00:38:06,534 --> 00:38:10,413
Tomorrow night
we can get high...

417
00:38:10,496 --> 00:38:14,166

burn from that window.

418
00:38:17,002 --> 00:38:20,171
- * I am the park *
- ( Caws )

419
00:38:20,213 --> 00:38:23,842
* I am glow *

420
00:38:23,925 --> 00:38:28,012
* In the motherfucking dark *

421
00:38:28,054 --> 00:38:30,223
* I am shocked *

422
00:38:30,306 --> 00:38:32,517
* And I see *

423
00:38:32,600 --> 00:38:35,769
* I don't want to believe *

424
00:38:35,853 --> 00:38:38,981
* No more *

425
00:38:39,064 --> 00:38:41,692
- There's a big fucking bird over there.

426
00:38:41,734 --> 00:38:43,735
- Huh?
- ( Cawing )

427
00:38:44,903 --> 00:38:47,781
- It's a squab.
- ( Laughing )

428
00:38:47,864 --> 00:38:50,491
Come here, bird.

429
00:38:50,575 --> 00:38:52,660
Hey, bird.
Hey, bird.

430
00:38:52,744 --> 00:38:55,079
Bird. B-B-Birdie.

431
00:38:55,121 --> 00:38:57,749
Here, birdie, birdie.

432
00:38:57,791 --> 00:39:00,793
Come here, birdie,
birdie, birdie.

433
00:39:03,421 --> 00:39:06,631
Birdie? Hey, birdie?

434
00:39:06,715 --> 00:39:09,301
Here, Funboy.

435
00:39:11,637 --> 00:39:13,596
What the fuck?

436
00:39:17,392 --> 00:39:19,936

437
00:39:19,978 --> 00:39:24,523
No, man! Don't do that! You nearly
gave me a fucking heart attack!

438
00:39:24,607 --> 00:39:26,776
Look at him.

439
00:39:26,818 --> 00:39:29,695
( Funboy ) Don't sweat it.

440
00:39:31,405 --> 00:39:34,450
It's time for you to take
your bird and leave, freako.

441
00:39:42,374 --> 00:39:47,211
Take your shot, Funboy.
You got me dead bang.

442
00:39:49,213 --> 00:39:54,134
You are seriously fucked up.
Did you look in the mirror?

443
00:39:54,218 --> 00:39:57,721
You need professional help.

444
00:39:59,515 --> 00:40:02,100
- ( Groaning )
- Bingo!

445
00:40:02,184 --> 00:40:04,811
He shoots! He scores!

446
00:40:06,980 --> 00:40:09,982
- ( Cawing )
- ( Laughing )

447
00:40:11,317 --> 00:40:14,904

448
00:40:14,946 --> 00:40:18,657
- Jesus Christ!

449
00:40:18,741 --> 00:40:21,452
Stop me if you heard this one.

450
00:40:21,535 --> 00:40:24,454
Jesus Christ

451
00:40:24,538 --> 00:40:26,456

452
00:40:26,540 --> 00:40:28,333
Ow.

453
00:40:29,877 --> 00:40:32,629
He hands the innkeeper

454
00:40:32,712 --> 00:40:36,257
Don't you ever fucking die?

455
00:40:36,341 --> 00:40:38,593
"Can you put me up for the night?"

456
00:40:38,635 --> 00:40:42,138
( Groaning )

457
00:40:44,098 --> 00:40:48,685
- Does that hurt?
- Fuck. Does it-- Fuck, does it hurt?

458
00:40:48,769 --> 00:40:50,813
Oh, God.

459
00:40:50,896 --> 00:40:54,983
Look what you've done
to my sheets.

460
00:40:56,901 --> 00:40:58,528

461
00:41:04,951 --> 00:41:06,702

462
00:41:06,786 --> 00:41:10,330
( Sobbing )

463

I've got a gun
in my pocket.

464
00:41:24,261 --> 00:41:26,971
You're happy to see me,

465
00:41:44,738 --> 00:41:48,617
Stay away!
Stay away from me!

466
00:41:50,076 --> 00:41:52,328

467
00:41:56,458 --> 00:42:00,294
Look.

468
00:42:00,336 --> 00:42:04,840
Mother is the name for God

469
00:42:04,923 --> 00:42:09,678

470
00:42:20,105 --> 00:42:24,901

471
00:42:54,678 --> 00:42:58,349
If I wanted ice,

472
00:42:58,432 --> 00:43:00,684
Now fill it up!

473
00:43:01,768 --> 00:43:05,147
Fill it up yourself, macho man.

474
00:43:05,230 --> 00:43:07,899
I really need this.

475
00:43:14,447 --> 00:43:16,448
All right.

476
00:43:16,490 --> 00:43:20,453

477
00:43:20,494 --> 00:43:23,080

- You have an appointment.

478
00:43:23,163 --> 00:43:25,624
- Well, shit on me.

479
00:43:25,707 --> 00:43:28,627

480
00:43:28,711 --> 00:43:31,504

481
00:43:31,588 --> 00:43:35,008
Oh! Hey, hey, hon!

482
00:43:35,091 --> 00:43:38,011

483
00:43:40,429 --> 00:43:44,142

00:43:52,191 --> 00:43:55,652

485
00:44:12,251 --> 00:44:14,837

486

487
00:44:26,806 --> 00:44:32,562

488
00:44:32,604 --> 00:44:35,356
- ( Door Squeaking )
- the site of last year's biggest
Devil's Night conflagration.

489
00:44:35,439 --> 00:44:38,401
It was exactly one year ago
that the building you see...

490
00:44:38,484 --> 00:44:41,445

was totally demolished by fire.

491
00:44:41,486 --> 00:44:43,655
The fire that was fought
by seven fire companies...

492
00:44:43,739 --> 00:44:45,866
but lost the lives
of two fire fighters.

493
00:44:45,949 --> 00:44:50,703
In fact, if it weren't for the constant
surveillance by the local police--

494
00:44:50,787 --> 00:44:53,707
Freeze!

495
00:44:53,790 --> 00:44:57,293
Jesus. Don't ever do that, man.

496
00:44:57,334 --> 00:44:59,337
( Whispering ) Fuck.

497
00:45:01,297 --> 00:45:03,466
Good likeness.

498
00:45:03,549 --> 00:45:07,261
I saw your body, man.
You died. You got buried.

499
00:45:07,344 --> 00:45:09,597
You still have your hat on.

500
00:45:13,516 --> 00:45:15,602
I gotta sit down.

501
00:45:16,394 --> 00:45:18,355
Shi--

502
00:45:18,397 --> 00:45:21,274
( Albrecht ) Holy Shit.

503
00:45:22,733 --> 00:45:25,361
Say...

504
00:45:25,445 --> 00:45:29,740
are you some kind of... ghost?

505
00:45:29,823 --> 00:45:31,784
Boo!

506
00:45:39,374 --> 00:45:43,920
I don't know what I am. I need you
to tell me what happened to us.

507
00:45:45,922 --> 00:45:50,010
You took a six-story swan dive
out of a window.

508
00:45:50,093 --> 00:45:53,179
She, ah, was beaten and raped.

509
00:45:53,262 --> 00:45:57,850
Died at the hospital.
Hey, you asked, man.

510
00:45:57,934 --> 00:46:00,560
Come on. Read the file.

511
00:46:00,644 --> 00:46:04,982
Shelly Webster held on
for 30 hours in intensive care.

512
00:46:05,065 --> 00:46:08,276
Her body finally just gave it up.

513
00:46:08,318 --> 00:46:12,197
I saw it.
I couldn't do jack for her.

514
00:46:22,080 --> 00:46:23,999
- Hey.
- Don't touch me!

515
00:46:24,082 --> 00:46:28,087
- ( Sobbing )
- Hey.

516
00:46:29,505 --> 00:46:32,340
You okay?

517
00:46:32,382 --> 00:46:35,093
I saw her.

518
00:46:36,720 --> 00:46:40,014
I saw her
through your eyes.

519
00:46:40,097 --> 00:46:42,183
You stayed with her
the whole time.

520
00:46:42,266 --> 00:46:47,730
Yeah, well, you got to
understand something, all right?

521
00:46:47,813 --> 00:46:52,568
I was hoping
she'd come out of it, you know.

522
00:46:52,610 --> 00:46:55,570
Give me something
I could work with.

523
00:46:55,612 --> 00:46:57,864
Yeah.

524
00:46:57,906 --> 00:47:00,367
Look, I--

525
00:47:00,409 --> 00:47:02,910
Why didn't you do
something about it?

526
00:47:02,994 --> 00:47:06,331
You think any people in that building,
even the ones who signed the petition...

527
00:47:06,414 --> 00:47:09,875
would talk after
what happened to you?

528
00:47:09,959 --> 00:47:13,170
I kept asking
questions and...

529
00:47:13,254 --> 00:47:15,923
finally got busted for sticking
my nose where it wasn't wanted.

530
00:47:19,926 --> 00:47:21,887
This your wife?

531
00:47:21,970 --> 00:47:26,432
Yeah, we, uh-- Well, not anymore,
we're getting a divorce.

532
00:47:28,309 --> 00:47:31,271
It's funny.

533
00:47:31,313 --> 00:47:35,316
Little things used to mean
so much to Shelly.

534
00:47:35,399 --> 00:47:38,903
I used to think
they were kind of trivial.

535
00:47:38,986 --> 00:47:41,989
Believe me,
nothing is trivial.

536
00:47:51,623 --> 00:47:56,085
You shouldn't smoke these.
They'll kill you.

537
00:48:00,757 --> 00:48:03,967
You going to vanish
into thin air again?

538
00:48:07,596 --> 00:48:10,307
I thought I'd use
your front door.

539
00:48:13,351 --> 00:48:19,190
Look, man, I'm sorry as hell for what
happened to you and your girlfriend.

540
00:48:20,733 --> 00:48:23,069
Yeah.

541
00:48:27,614 --> 00:48:30,201
- ( Door Opening, Closing )
- ( Whispering ) Yeah.

542
00:48:30,284 --> 00:48:33,788
( Gideon ) I got stabbed!
I shot the son of a bitch!

543
00:48:33,871 --> 00:48:36,998
I watched the bullet hole
close by itself.

544
00:48:37,082 --> 00:48:40,127
And then my business
gets blown up real good.

545
00:48:40,210 --> 00:48:43,463
- Other than that, my day sucked.
- Yeah.

546
00:48:43,504 --> 00:48:46,049
I saw him too.
He had a guitar.

547
00:48:46,132 --> 00:48:50,553
He winked at me before he jumped out
a fourth-floor window like he had wings.

548
00:48:50,636 --> 00:48:55,641
He winked at ya?
Musicians.

549
00:48:55,725 --> 00:48:58,185
- What else did you see?
- So far I haven't heard...

550
00:48:58,268 --> 00:49:00,771
shit about what you're going to do
about all this crap!

551
00:49:00,854 --> 00:49:06,359
What do I get? My livelihood
got flushed and went swirling.

552
00:49:06,442 --> 00:49:09,195
You ain't lost everything.

553
00:49:09,279 --> 00:49:14,367
Yeah, and maybe you're not
such a big shot either! Ow! Jesus!

554
00:49:14,450 --> 00:49:18,037
Fair enough. Catch.

555
00:49:19,163 --> 00:49:21,582
Aah! Jesus.

556
00:49:21,665 --> 00:49:24,084
Say hello to the last fellow
who wouldn't cooperate with me.

557
00:49:24,168 --> 00:49:26,170
What're you telling me,
this thing is real?

558
00:49:26,211 --> 00:49:29,881
All the power in the world
resides in the eyes, fella.

559
00:49:29,964 --> 00:49:33,927
Sometimes they're more useful
than the people who bear them.

560
00:49:34,010 --> 00:49:38,139
You're directly out of
your fucking mind! You know that!

561
00:49:38,222 --> 00:49:40,892
Yeah.

562
00:49:40,933 --> 00:49:46,105
Eyes see. It's one of the most important
things I learned from my sister.

563
00:49:46,188 --> 00:49:49,442
Sister? She's supposed to be
your sister? ( Laughing )

564
00:49:49,525 --> 00:49:52,861
My father's daughter.
That's right.

565
00:49:52,944 --> 00:49:56,114
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

566
00:49:56,198 --> 00:49:58,450
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

567
00:49:58,534 --> 00:50:02,036
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

568
00:50:02,161 --> 00:50:05,623
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

569
00:50:05,707 --> 00:50:09,084
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

570
00:50:09,168 --> 00:50:11,420
Whatever the fuck that means.

571
00:50:11,462 --> 00:50:15,258
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

572
00:50:16,341 --> 00:50:18,427
Want to relax
that thing now?

573
00:50:18,468 --> 00:50:23,140
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

574
00:50:23,222 --> 00:50:27,602
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

575
00:50:27,644 --> 00:50:30,355
I ain't making all this up.

576
00:50:30,438 --> 00:50:34,942
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

577
00:50:36,736 --> 00:50:38,862
All right.

578
00:50:43,534 --> 00:50:48,538
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

579
00:50:48,621 --> 00:50:52,292
Yeah. ( Laughing )

580
00:50:58,798 --> 00:51:01,801
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

581
00:51:08,724 --> 00:51:11,059
Thanks.

582
00:51:11,101 --> 00:51:13,395
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

583
00:51:13,478 --> 00:51:16,064
A big one.

584
00:51:16,148 --> 00:51:21,027
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

585
00:51:21,110 --> 00:51:25,031
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

586
00:51:29,452 --> 00:51:31,621
( Purring )

587
00:51:31,704 --> 00:51:36,625
** ( Electric Guitar )

588
00:51:48,094 --> 00:51:51,889
( Siren Wailing )

589
00:52:21,125 --> 00:52:26,714
- ** ( Rock Playing )
- ( Crow Caws )

590
00:52:26,797 --> 00:52:29,049
You again.

591
00:52:29,132 --> 00:52:31,510
You lost or hungry?

592
00:52:31,551 --> 00:52:34,388
- Hi.
- ( Caws )

593
00:52:36,722 --> 00:52:38,641
* It can't rain all the time *

594
00:52:38,725 --> 00:52:43,229
( Skipping )
* Can't rain all the time *

595
00:52:52,320 --> 00:52:55,032
( T-bird ) I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

596
00:52:55,115 --> 00:52:58,035
One part falls, it all falls!

597
00:52:58,118 --> 00:53:01,579
- You know how long it took us
to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

598
00:53:01,621 --> 00:53:04,207
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

599
00:53:04,290 --> 00:53:06,376
Tin Tin was a dick.

600
00:53:06,459 --> 00:53:09,420
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

601
00:53:09,503 --> 00:53:13,716
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

602
00:53:13,800 --> 00:53:15,717
Fire it up!

603
00:53:18,303 --> 00:53:20,389
No Funboy.

604
00:53:20,472 --> 00:53:24,392
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

605
00:53:24,476 --> 00:53:27,395
- ( Grunting )
- ( Whistles )

606
00:53:29,773 --> 00:53:32,858
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

607
00:53:32,942 --> 00:53:34,944
I'm on it.

608
00:53:40,532 --> 00:53:45,829
( Man Talking On Phone )

609
00:53:45,912 --> 00:53:48,874
( Sighs )

610
00:53:53,086 --> 00:53:55,505
( Cawing )

611
00:54:05,598 --> 00:54:09,184
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

612
00:54:09,267 --> 00:54:13,897
- ( Cawing )
- I'm your passenger.

613
00:54:20,778 --> 00:54:22,947
Drive.

614
00:54:25,032 --> 00:54:27,993
( Motor Starts )

615
00:54:28,035 --> 00:54:29,829
What's all this
happy horseshit?

616
00:54:29,912 --> 00:54:32,039
- ( Tires Screeching )
- Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

617
00:54:32,123 --> 00:54:35,375
- ( Horn Honking )
- ( Screams )

618
00:54:35,459 --> 00:54:37,377
( Brakes Screeching )

619
00:54:37,461 --> 00:54:40,713
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

620
00:54:40,797 --> 00:54:44,801
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

621
00:54:44,843 --> 00:54:47,095
( Groaning )

622
00:54:51,766 --> 00:54:56,186
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

623
00:54:57,813 --> 00:55:00,691
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

624
00:55:00,774 --> 00:55:03,860
- This is business, right?
- ( Gun Cocks ) Faster.

625
00:55:06,821 --> 00:55:11,034
You got that cream stuff?

626
00:55:11,076 --> 00:55:13,494
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

627
00:55:15,079 --> 00:55:18,082
- What in the crap--
- ( Tires Screech, Siren Wails )

628
00:55:18,124 --> 00:55:20,334
( Screaming )

629
00:55:21,585 --> 00:55:24,422
Oh, look. Making us popular.

630
00:55:24,463 --> 00:55:27,173
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

631
00:55:27,257 --> 00:55:32,679
( Siren Wailing )

632
00:55:32,763 --> 00:55:35,723
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

633
00:55:38,268 --> 00:55:40,437
Turn.

634
00:55:41,771 --> 00:55:44,523
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

635
00:55:44,607 --> 00:55:48,945
- Right? Huh?
- ( Crow Cawing )

636
00:55:50,487 --> 00:55:52,990
( Groans )
Damn! Dead end!

637
00:55:53,031 --> 00:55:55,284
( Cawing )

638
00:55:58,369 --> 00:56:00,830
- ( Man ) Look out!
- ( Woman Screams )

639
00:56:04,167 --> 00:56:06,377
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

640
00:56:17,471 --> 00:56:21,724
- ( Engine Rattling )
- Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

641
00:56:21,808 --> 00:56:25,353
( Siren Wailing )

642
00:56:25,395 --> 00:56:27,898
Shit! Shit!

643
00:56:35,029 --> 00:56:38,741
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

644
00:56:40,159 --> 00:56:43,621
T-bird!
I got you, man!

645
00:56:43,704 --> 00:56:46,081
- Shit!
- ( Screaming )

646
00:56:49,876 --> 00:56:54,881
( Groaning, Car Door Chiming )

647
00:56:59,469 --> 00:57:01,762
( T-bird ) Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

648
00:57:01,845 --> 00:57:05,099
But I don't know what--
What? Huh? What?

649
00:57:05,141 --> 00:57:07,935
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

650
00:57:07,977 --> 00:57:11,104
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

651
00:57:11,146 --> 00:57:13,315
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

652
00:57:13,398 --> 00:57:16,651
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

653
00:57:16,734 --> 00:57:20,321
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

654
00:57:20,405 --> 00:57:23,824
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

655
00:57:23,908 --> 00:57:27,161
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

656
00:57:27,244 --> 00:57:32,165
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

657
00:57:33,750 --> 00:57:35,627
Did you send us
these complaints?

658
00:57:37,338 --> 00:57:40,673
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

659
00:57:40,715 --> 00:57:43,093
Does it get you sweaty?

660
00:57:43,176 --> 00:57:48,389
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

661
00:57:48,431 --> 00:57:52,518
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

662
00:57:52,685 --> 00:57:56,605
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

663
00:57:56,688 --> 00:58:00,150
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

664
00:58:00,192 --> 00:58:02,570
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

665
00:58:02,652 --> 00:58:07,115
( Grunting, Muttering )
T-bird--

666
00:58:07,199 --> 00:58:10,160
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

667
00:58:12,703 --> 00:58:16,875
- T-bird.
- ( T-bird Panting )

668
00:58:16,958 --> 00:58:20,336
- ( Engine Revs )
- "Abashed the devil stood...

669
00:58:20,377 --> 00:58:23,339
and felt how awful goodness is."

670
00:58:23,422 --> 00:58:26,299
"And felt how awful goodness is."

671
00:58:31,054 --> 00:58:35,058
( Tires Squealing )

672
00:58:40,355 --> 00:58:42,940
( Gasping )
T-bird. T-bird.

673
00:59:10,675 --> 00:59:13,969
( Crow Caws )

674
00:59:33,321 --> 00:59:35,615
( Woman ) This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

675
00:59:35,698 --> 00:59:38,033
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

676
00:59:38,075 --> 00:59:42,455
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

677
00:59:42,538 --> 00:59:45,957
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

678
00:59:46,041 --> 00:59:51,422
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

679
00:59:51,463 --> 00:59:56,634
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

680
00:59:56,718 --> 01:00:00,346
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties--

681
01:00:00,429 --> 01:00:04,225
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

682
01:00:06,269 --> 01:00:08,979
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

683
01:00:09,062 --> 01:00:13,984
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

684
01:00:14,068 --> 01:00:18,196
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

685
01:00:18,279 --> 01:00:21,616
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

686
01:00:21,658 --> 01:00:26,787
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

687
01:00:26,829 --> 01:00:32,626
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

688
01:00:32,668 --> 01:00:37,923
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

689
01:00:40,425 --> 01:00:44,721
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

690
01:00:44,805 --> 01:00:47,014
Over easy.

691
01:00:49,100 --> 01:00:53,813
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

692
01:01:04,406 --> 01:01:06,658
Hey, Albrecht.

693
01:01:06,742 --> 01:01:09,328
( Sighs )

694
01:01:09,411 --> 01:01:12,330
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

695
01:01:12,413 --> 01:01:15,667
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

696
01:01:15,750 --> 01:01:19,962
- We're gonna have to l.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

697
01:01:20,045 --> 01:01:21,964
Arson was his specialty.

698
01:01:22,048 --> 01:01:24,008
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

699
01:01:24,091 --> 01:01:28,011
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'-shit.

700
01:01:28,095 --> 01:01:30,347
Come here.

701
01:01:34,100 --> 01:01:36,060
You're holding out on me.

702
01:01:36,144 --> 01:01:39,689
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

703
01:01:39,773 --> 01:01:43,025
and you're covering up
for somebody.

704
01:01:43,109 --> 01:01:45,528
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

705
01:01:45,611 --> 01:01:49,489
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

706
01:01:49,573 --> 01:01:51,700
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

707
01:01:51,784 --> 01:01:54,662
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

708
01:01:54,703 --> 01:01:57,664
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

709
01:01:57,747 --> 01:01:59,666
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

710
01:01:59,749 --> 01:02:02,043
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

711
01:02:02,127 --> 01:02:04,128
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

712
01:02:04,211 --> 01:02:06,214
You gotta write that shit down.

713
01:02:06,255 --> 01:02:08,216
All right, smart-ass.

714
01:02:08,257 --> 01:02:11,344
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

715
01:02:11,386 --> 01:02:15,347
- Welcome to the first day
of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

716
01:02:15,389 --> 01:02:19,143
- For what?
- Misconduct.

717
01:02:19,226 --> 01:02:23,230
( Dials Phone )
Yeah, give me the lab.

718
01:02:23,313 --> 01:02:27,900
( Thunder Rumbling )

719
01:02:38,160 --> 01:02:40,079
( Grunting )

720
01:03:06,312 --> 01:03:10,190
** ( Electric Guitar )

721
01:03:13,986 --> 01:03:16,571
( Shelly ) One for sorrow,
two for joy...

722
01:03:16,654 --> 01:03:19,491
- Come here.
- ...three for a girl, four for a boy.

723
01:03:24,537 --> 01:03:28,333
Dancing--

724
01:03:38,550 --> 01:03:41,303
( Paper Ripping )

725
01:03:59,445 --> 01:04:01,404
Eric?

726
01:04:01,446 --> 01:04:04,074
( Rain Falling )

727
01:04:04,116 --> 01:04:08,412
( Sighs ) Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

728
01:04:08,454 --> 01:04:11,414
- Gabriel.
- ( Meows )

729
01:04:11,456 --> 01:04:14,250
I thought you were dead.

730
01:04:14,292 --> 01:04:17,586
You're not dead, are you?

731
01:04:42,360 --> 01:04:45,279
I knew it was you.

732
01:04:47,198 --> 01:04:50,117
Even with the makeup.

733
01:04:54,955 --> 01:04:57,540
I remembered your song.

734
01:04:57,624 --> 01:05:01,378
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

735
01:05:01,461 --> 01:05:04,714
That is from your song, right?

736
01:05:14,640 --> 01:05:17,768
- ( Cawing )
- Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

737
01:05:20,145 --> 01:05:24,233
I miss you...
and Shelly.

738
01:05:27,318 --> 01:05:30,780
Get so lonely
all by myself.

739
01:05:32,615 --> 01:05:37,244
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

740
01:05:37,328 --> 01:05:40,456
Sarah, I do care.

741
01:05:51,674 --> 01:05:53,802
That's him.
That's him!

742
01:05:53,885 --> 01:05:57,222
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

743
01:05:57,305 --> 01:06:00,558
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

744
01:06:00,641 --> 01:06:03,186
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

745
01:06:03,269 --> 01:06:06,063
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

746
01:06:06,146 --> 01:06:09,650
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

747
01:06:09,733 --> 01:06:13,653
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

748
01:06:14,988 --> 01:06:19,576
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

749
01:06:19,659 --> 01:06:22,245
- Empty.
- Fire it--

750
01:06:22,328 --> 01:06:24,247
Grave?
What grave?

751
01:06:24,330 --> 01:06:26,541
What about
my fucking grave?

752
01:06:26,624 --> 01:06:27,959
- ( Screams )
- Three out of four.

753
01:06:28,042 --> 01:06:31,295
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

754
01:06:31,378 --> 01:06:34,006
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

755
01:06:34,089 --> 01:06:37,259
That boy was out of control.
T-bird, he came in, he says...
( Whistles )

756
01:06:37,342 --> 01:06:40,637
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

757
01:06:40,721 --> 01:06:44,599
( Groaning )

758
01:06:44,682 --> 01:06:47,769
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

759
01:06:47,852 --> 01:06:51,606
- This ghost gonna kill--
- Hey.

760
01:06:51,690 --> 01:06:53,649
That ain't no ghost.

761
01:06:55,568 --> 01:06:58,738
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

762
01:06:58,779 --> 01:07:00,781
We might need him.

763
01:07:02,282 --> 01:07:04,743
Ghost gonna kill my--

764
01:07:17,463 --> 01:07:21,426
He like his plain
or with onions?

765
01:07:21,467 --> 01:07:24,928
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

766
01:07:24,970 --> 01:07:29,099
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

767
01:07:29,141 --> 01:07:31,768
That's what I thought.

768
01:07:31,810 --> 01:07:34,604
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

769
01:07:34,646 --> 01:07:36,940
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

770
01:07:36,982 --> 01:07:40,610
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

771
01:07:40,693 --> 01:07:46,032
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

772
01:07:46,115 --> 01:07:49,618
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

773
01:07:49,702 --> 01:07:52,621
Eric didn't come back for me.

774
01:07:52,705 --> 01:07:57,459
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

775
01:07:57,542 --> 01:08:00,712
You want a friend
to walk you home?

776
01:08:00,796 --> 01:08:06,050
** ( Electric Guitar )

777
01:08:31,241 --> 01:08:34,243
- ( Screaming )
- * I am the wicked
I am the wave of the future *

778
01:08:47,298 --> 01:08:49,257
( Woman ) * Being crucified *

779
01:08:49,299 --> 01:08:53,637
* You things, things
things of the flesh *

780
01:08:53,678 --> 01:08:56,390
* Do it slow *

781
01:08:56,473 --> 01:09:00,768
* Down avenues "cut me" *

782
01:09:00,852 --> 01:09:04,522
* Lust my eyes *

783
01:09:04,606 --> 01:09:10,861
* Licking lips encouraging
Mr. Careworn *

784
01:09:10,945 --> 01:09:17,075
* To gaze upon the screen bask on *

785
01:09:17,159 --> 01:09:19,161
* After the flesh **

786
01:09:31,172 --> 01:09:34,759
( Whimpering )

787
01:09:34,842 --> 01:09:37,761
Boys.

788
01:09:37,844 --> 01:09:41,265
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

789
01:09:41,348 --> 01:09:43,434
on account of
a slight case of death.

790
01:09:43,517 --> 01:09:45,476
- ( Men Chuckling )
- You wanna sit down?

791
01:09:45,560 --> 01:09:50,941
- ( Groaning )
- Well, well, well.

792
01:09:50,982 --> 01:09:54,068
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

793
01:09:54,110 --> 01:09:56,070
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

794
01:09:56,112 --> 01:09:59,406
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

795
01:09:59,448 --> 01:10:01,700
I like the pretty lights.

796
01:10:01,783 --> 01:10:04,620
( Laughing )

797
01:10:04,703 --> 01:10:08,623
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

798
01:10:08,665 --> 01:10:13,879
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

799
01:10:13,962 --> 01:10:16,339
Only reason to quit.

800
01:10:16,422 --> 01:10:21,928
A man has an idea.

801
01:10:22,011 --> 01:10:24,263
The idea attracts others...

802
01:10:24,346 --> 01:10:26,432
like-minded.

803
01:10:26,515 --> 01:10:28,601
The idea expands.

804
01:10:28,684 --> 01:10:32,312
The idea becomes
an institution.

805
01:10:32,395 --> 01:10:35,065
What was the idea?

806
01:10:35,148 --> 01:10:38,901
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

807
01:10:38,985 --> 01:10:41,779
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

808
01:10:41,863 --> 01:10:44,949
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

809
01:10:45,033 --> 01:10:47,201
You see, gentlemen...

810
01:10:47,284 --> 01:10:52,289
greed is for amateurs.

811
01:10:52,373 --> 01:10:57,544
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

812
01:10:57,627 --> 01:11:00,214
now that's fun!

813
01:11:00,297 --> 01:11:02,590
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

814
01:11:02,673 --> 01:11:06,094
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

815
01:11:06,136 --> 01:11:09,222
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

816
01:11:09,305 --> 01:11:12,767
Do you know
what they got now?

817
01:11:12,808 --> 01:11:17,104
Devil's Night greeting cards.

818
01:11:17,145 --> 01:11:20,107
Isn't that precious?

819
01:11:20,148 --> 01:11:22,276
Yeah.

820
01:11:22,317 --> 01:11:27,113
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

821
01:11:27,155 --> 01:11:29,199
Time to move along.

822
01:11:29,282 --> 01:11:31,701
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

823
01:11:31,785 --> 01:11:34,286
No.

824
01:11:34,328 --> 01:11:36,956
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

825
01:11:36,998 --> 01:11:40,126
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

826
01:11:40,168 --> 01:11:42,795
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

827
01:11:42,836 --> 01:11:47,299
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

828
01:11:47,341 --> 01:11:49,467
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

829
01:11:49,509 --> 01:11:51,469
Skank!
You don't feel that?

830
01:11:51,511 --> 01:11:54,848
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.
- ( All Laughing )

831
01:11:54,890 --> 01:11:57,308
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

832
01:11:57,391 --> 01:12:01,771
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

833
01:12:01,854 --> 01:12:04,189
- ( Crow Caws )
- ( Gasps )

834
01:12:04,231 --> 01:12:06,859
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

835
01:12:08,277 --> 01:12:10,780
- Gentlemen.
- ( Skank Screams )

836
01:12:10,863 --> 01:12:15,492
( Skank Whimpering ) Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

837
01:12:20,037 --> 01:12:23,833
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

838
01:12:23,875 --> 01:12:26,378
The killer of killers.

839
01:12:26,461 --> 01:12:29,296
- Nice outfit.
- ( Whimpering )

840
01:12:29,380 --> 01:12:31,424
I'm not sure
about the face though.

841
01:12:31,507 --> 01:12:33,551
I just want him.

842
01:12:33,634 --> 01:12:37,054
- ( Whimpering )
- Well, you can't have him.

843
01:12:37,137 --> 01:12:39,807
Well...

844
01:12:41,892 --> 01:12:44,352
I see you have
made your decision.

845
01:12:45,937 --> 01:12:47,897
Now let's see you enforce it.

846
01:12:47,981 --> 01:12:51,650
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

847
01:12:57,532 --> 01:13:01,452
Ooh, that had to hurt.

848
01:13:01,535 --> 01:13:04,330
- ( All Laughing )
- Well, that's that.

849
01:13:04,413 --> 01:13:07,582
- ( Laughing Continues )
- That guy was crazy.

850
01:13:09,918 --> 01:13:12,754
( Caws )

851
01:13:14,213 --> 01:13:16,007
He's gone.
( Screams )

852
01:13:16,090 --> 01:13:21,762
( Screaming, Gunfire )

853
01:13:24,056 --> 01:13:25,766
Get him!

854
01:13:31,229 --> 01:13:34,691
- ( Whimpering )
- ( Gunfire )

855
01:13:43,032 --> 01:13:45,826
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

856
01:13:49,872 --> 01:13:51,874
Jesus Christ!

857
01:14:08,306 --> 01:14:10,266
Hey!

858
01:14:42,796 --> 01:14:45,132
You're all going to die.

859
01:14:56,517 --> 01:15:00,063
( Screaming )

860
01:15:00,146 --> 01:15:02,981
( Man ) Get the fuck outta here!

861
01:15:15,244 --> 01:15:17,830
( Crowd Screaming )

862
01:15:17,913 --> 01:15:23,376
( Whimpering, Gasping )

863
01:15:28,005 --> 01:15:32,969
( Whimpering )

864
01:15:33,052 --> 01:15:34,553
( Screams )

865
01:15:38,766 --> 01:15:41,685
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

866
01:15:41,769 --> 01:15:44,979
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

867
01:15:45,063 --> 01:15:48,942
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

868
01:15:49,025 --> 01:15:50,818
( Screaming ) No!

869
01:15:50,901 --> 01:15:55,365
( Whimpering )

870
01:15:55,448 --> 01:15:59,117
- ( Body Crashing )
- What in the crap--

871
01:16:00,452 --> 01:16:03,080
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

872
01:16:03,163 --> 01:16:06,583
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

873
01:16:13,464 --> 01:16:15,633
( Siren Blaring )

874
01:16:15,675 --> 01:16:18,553
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

875
01:16:18,636 --> 01:16:21,930
( Gunfire Continues )

876
01:16:22,014 --> 01:16:25,643
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

877
01:16:25,726 --> 01:16:27,853
...arms and legs--

878
01:16:33,400 --> 01:16:38,196
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs--

879
01:17:18,817 --> 01:17:23,446
- ( Tires Screeching )
- Come on! Move it!

880
01:17:27,868 --> 01:17:30,995
My advice:
Next time duck.

881
01:17:33,039 --> 01:17:35,416
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

882
01:17:35,500 --> 01:17:38,836
- ( Sirens Wailing )
- ( Brakes Screeching )

883
01:17:38,877 --> 01:17:42,006
- Shit!
- ( Door Opening )

884
01:17:44,884 --> 01:17:47,802
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

885
01:17:47,886 --> 01:17:50,347
Look at that out there.

886
01:17:50,389 --> 01:17:53,350
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

887
01:17:53,392 --> 01:17:56,602
Sky oughta be red.

888
01:17:56,686 --> 01:18:01,024
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

889
01:18:01,066 --> 01:18:06,779
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

890
01:18:06,862 --> 01:18:09,823
- I like him already.
- The crow...

891
01:18:09,906 --> 01:18:14,369
is his link between
the land of the living...

892
01:18:14,453 --> 01:18:16,789
and the realm of the dead.

893
01:18:16,872 --> 01:18:21,418
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

894
01:18:21,459 --> 01:18:23,461
Hmm.

895
01:18:46,566 --> 01:18:48,568
I'm coming home, Shelly.

896
01:18:48,652 --> 01:18:50,820
( Laughing )

897
01:18:50,903 --> 01:18:56,617
( Laughing Continues )

898
01:18:56,700 --> 01:18:58,660
( Chuckles )

899
01:19:02,915 --> 01:19:07,127
( Children Laughing, Hooting )

900
01:19:07,210 --> 01:19:11,465
( Laughing )

901
01:19:37,655 --> 01:19:40,116
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

902
01:19:40,158 --> 01:19:42,244
in the middle
of the night, right?

903
01:19:42,285 --> 01:19:44,078
Safest place in the world to be.

904
01:19:44,119 --> 01:19:48,916
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

905
01:19:48,958 --> 01:19:53,128
It's really late, Sarah.

906
01:19:53,211 --> 01:19:55,964
You didn't say good-bye.

907
01:19:56,090 --> 01:20:00,051
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

908
01:20:00,135 --> 01:20:04,389
And you're never coming back.

909
01:20:10,686 --> 01:20:13,940
I gave this to Shelly once.

910
01:20:17,651 --> 01:20:20,613
I think she'd like you
to have it.

911
01:20:24,658 --> 01:20:26,952
This way you'll
always remember her.

912
01:20:26,993 --> 01:20:29,580
I'll never take it off.

913
01:20:47,721 --> 01:20:51,558
I better go sneak
back in the house.

914
01:20:57,689 --> 01:20:59,649
Bye.

915
01:21:19,626 --> 01:21:22,462
- ( Muffled Screaming )
- Shh! Shh!

916
01:21:24,381 --> 01:21:26,799
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

917
01:21:26,841 --> 01:21:31,638
( Muffled Screaming Continues )

918
01:21:33,722 --> 01:21:36,183
Come on.
Come on.

919
01:21:49,487 --> 01:21:53,616
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

920
01:21:55,201 --> 01:21:58,329
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

921
01:22:04,751 --> 01:22:08,046
Her eyes are so innocent.

922
01:22:19,390 --> 01:22:21,350
- ( Sarah ) Eric!
- ( Caws )

923
01:22:21,392 --> 01:22:25,354
Eric, help! Eric!

924
01:22:28,940 --> 01:22:32,069
( Thunderclap )

925
01:22:34,113 --> 01:22:36,030
( Crow Caws )

926
01:22:49,961 --> 01:22:52,171
( Crow Flapping, Caws )

927
01:23:04,808 --> 01:23:08,019
Quick impression for ya.

928
01:23:08,102 --> 01:23:11,814
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

929
01:23:11,898 --> 01:23:15,234
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

930
01:23:15,317 --> 01:23:18,362
( Inhales )
Well, well.

931
01:23:18,445 --> 01:23:22,198
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

932
01:23:26,662 --> 01:23:29,081
( Cawing )

933
01:23:30,164 --> 01:23:32,458
Nah. Fuck it.

934
01:23:38,464 --> 01:23:40,841
( Chuckles )

935
01:23:40,925 --> 01:23:43,052
Aw, fuck.

936
01:23:46,263 --> 01:23:50,225
( Muffled Screaming )

937
01:23:50,309 --> 01:23:54,854
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

938
01:23:54,938 --> 01:23:58,775
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

939
01:23:58,858 --> 01:24:03,029
( Groaning )

940
01:24:03,112 --> 01:24:06,491
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

941
01:24:10,035 --> 01:24:12,287
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

942
01:24:13,956 --> 01:24:16,166
Bye-bye, birdie.

943
01:25:01,250 --> 01:25:03,376
Ah, shit.

944
01:25:03,418 --> 01:25:05,545
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

945
01:25:05,587 --> 01:25:07,631
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

946
01:25:07,714 --> 01:25:10,300
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

947
01:25:10,383 --> 01:25:12,385
Two more.
( Groans )

948
01:25:12,427 --> 01:25:14,429
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

949
01:25:14,512 --> 01:25:17,057
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

950
01:25:17,098 --> 01:25:19,892
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

951
01:25:19,934 --> 01:25:23,688
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

952
01:25:26,314 --> 01:25:29,860
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

953
01:25:29,943 --> 01:25:31,987
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

954
01:25:32,071 --> 01:25:35,532
I was.
I'm not anymore.

955
01:25:35,615 --> 01:25:39,828
( Sighs ) Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

956
01:25:39,911 --> 01:25:42,830
- Come on.
- ( Groaning )

957
01:25:45,500 --> 01:25:47,543
You take that.

958
01:26:17,613 --> 01:26:21,074
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

959
01:26:43,221 --> 01:26:45,097
( Crow Caws )

960
01:26:45,180 --> 01:26:48,434
This is all the power
you ever had.

961
01:26:48,475 --> 01:26:50,602
Now it is mine.

962
01:26:50,644 --> 01:26:54,355
Pity there's not more time...

963
01:26:54,439 --> 01:26:57,067
- ( Gun Cocks )
- ...for us.

964
01:26:58,485 --> 01:27:04,240
( Woman Screaming )

965
01:27:05,908 --> 01:27:09,828
( Screaming )

966
01:27:11,163 --> 01:27:15,125
( Screaming Continues )

967
01:27:15,208 --> 01:27:18,044
( Sarah ) Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

968
01:27:20,172 --> 01:27:22,716
Let me go!

969
01:27:31,807 --> 01:27:35,352
Let her go!

970
01:27:35,394 --> 01:27:38,313
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

971
01:27:38,313 --> 01:27:40,023
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

972
01:27:40,065 --> 01:27:42,067
All right.

973
01:27:42,150 --> 01:27:44,194
- ( Sarah Screams )
- No!

974
01:27:47,989 --> 01:27:53,328
( Gasping, Groaning )

975
01:27:55,621 --> 01:27:57,665
( Crow Caws )

976
01:27:57,748 --> 01:28:00,126
( Thunderclap )

977
01:28:00,167 --> 01:28:02,502
( Gasping )

978
01:28:02,586 --> 01:28:04,713
- ( Thunderclap )
- ( Screams )

979
01:28:24,357 --> 01:28:27,234
( Swords Clanking )

980
01:28:27,317 --> 01:28:30,529
- ( Whimpering )
- ( Roof Collapsing )

981
01:28:30,613 --> 01:28:32,072
Eric!

982
01:28:34,449 --> 01:28:38,703
- ( Groaning )
- ( Laughing )

983
01:28:50,673 --> 01:28:54,009
- Sarah?
- Look out!

984
01:28:57,596 --> 01:29:01,099
- ( Panting )
- Eric!

985
01:29:09,107 --> 01:29:11,276
You know,
my daddy used to say...

986
01:29:11,359 --> 01:29:13,861
"Every man's got a devil...

987
01:29:13,944 --> 01:29:16,072
and you can't rest
till you find him."

988
01:29:16,155 --> 01:29:18,699
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend--

989
01:29:18,783 --> 01:29:21,702
I cleared that building.

990
01:29:21,785 --> 01:29:25,038
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

991
01:29:25,122 --> 01:29:27,957
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

992
01:29:28,041 --> 01:29:30,877
But if it's any consolation
to you...

993
01:29:30,960 --> 01:29:34,589
you have put
a smile on my face.

994
01:29:34,673 --> 01:29:37,299
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

995
01:29:37,341 --> 01:29:39,969
( Unsheathes Knife )
I am going to miss you.

996
01:29:40,011 --> 01:29:42,555
I have something
to give you.

997
01:29:42,638 --> 01:29:45,015
I don't want it anymore.

998
01:29:49,520 --> 01:29:52,522
Thirty hours of pain!

999
01:29:54,858 --> 01:29:57,569
- All at once!
- ( Groaning )

1000
01:29:57,652 --> 01:30:00,655
- ( Steady Tone )
- All for you.

1001
01:30:14,501 --> 01:30:17,921
( Gasping )

1002
01:30:26,262 --> 01:30:29,432
Yeah.

1003
01:30:36,272 --> 01:30:39,107
Go help him.

1004
01:30:42,444 --> 01:30:44,738
Are you alive?

1005
01:30:46,739 --> 01:30:50,744
( Groans )
God, I need a cigarette.

1006
01:30:56,707 --> 01:30:58,668
Everybody else dead?

1007
01:30:58,709 --> 01:31:01,002
You helped me.

1008
01:31:01,086 --> 01:31:03,630
What you kept in here
saved me.

1009
01:31:03,714 --> 01:31:06,842
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

1010
01:31:06,925 --> 01:31:09,928
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

1011
01:31:14,933 --> 01:31:17,685
Oh, yuck.
( Spits )

1012
01:31:17,768 --> 01:31:22,774
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

1013
01:31:31,240 --> 01:31:34,701
Stay with him
until help comes.

1014
01:31:34,743 --> 01:31:38,205
He'll be okay, right?

1015
01:31:38,288 --> 01:31:40,498
Eric?

1016
01:31:41,958 --> 01:31:45,545
( Sighs )
He does that a lot.

1017
01:31:47,422 --> 01:31:52,384
( Distant Sirens Approaching )

1018
01:31:52,468 --> 01:31:55,929
( Gasping, Groaning )

1019
01:31:55,971 --> 01:31:59,099
( Tires Screeching )

1020
01:32:01,810 --> 01:32:04,270
Shelly.

1021
01:32:16,490 --> 01:32:21,328
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

1022
01:32:21,411 --> 01:32:24,123
At least it stopped raining, huh?

1023
01:32:24,164 --> 01:32:27,584
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

1024
01:32:27,667 --> 01:32:31,004
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

1025
01:32:31,046 --> 01:32:33,006
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

1026
01:32:33,048 --> 01:32:37,635
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

1027
01:32:37,718 --> 01:32:39,762
You missed it.

1028
01:32:39,846 --> 01:32:42,514
Get him outta here!

1029
01:32:42,598 --> 01:32:45,184
( Chuckling )

1030
01:33:46,699 --> 01:33:48,660
Thanks.

1031
01:33:53,873 --> 01:33:56,918
( Sarah ) If the people we love
are stolen from us...

1032
01:33:57,001 --> 01:34:02,089
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

1033
01:34:02,172 --> 01:34:08,052
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.
